post.title: Building Side Effects
post.excerpt: Effects are one of the most powerful features in NGRX. Let’s see some practical examples, like calling an API or streaming real-time data

series.title: Introduction
series.excerpt: An Introduction to the NGRX platform — Concepts, Best Practices, and Tips

series.title: Architecting the Store
series.excerpt: A step-by-step guide to building and architecting the Store in NGRX

series.title: Building Side Effects
series.excerpt: Effects are one of the most powerful features in NGRX. Let’s see some practical examples, like calling an API or streaming real-time data

series.title: Abstracting State with Facades
series.excerpt: Using Ngrx facades to connect your components with your state

moreArticles.title: Benchmarking Angular 12 with Webpack 5
moreArticles.excerpt: Angular 12 has been released and with it the much awaited Webpack 5 upgrade. In this post I benchmarked the bundle-size and compilation speed against the previous version

moreArticles.excerpt: Working with Nx may be confusing. This article explains how I create Nx libraries and the principles behind my motivations

moreArticles.title: Where to put your Angular models?
moreArticles.excerpt: Organizing entities and models in your Angular app may be hard. This article explains where to put your entities and what mistakes to watch out for

moreArticles.title: Using the Intersection Observer API with Angular
moreArticles.excerpt: This article shows how to build a directive with Angular that uses the Intersection Observer API to check when an element becomes visible on the page

moreArticles.title: Setters vs ngOnChanges: which one is better?
moreArticles.excerpt: Listening to Input changes can be done in different ways. But which one should you use?

moreArticles.title: Async Rendering with a single Rx Operator
